thread.title: Trump uses gold driver while hosting Japanese prime minster
thread.title_full: Trump uses gold driver while hosting Japanese prime minster

title: Trump uses gold driver while hosting Japanese prime minster
text:
President Donald Trump is known for many things, including his controversial policies , late-night Twitter rants, golf courses and his love of things that are clad in gold. 
What do the latter two have in common? 
Well, normally not much, but the president hosted Japanese Prime Minister Shinzō Abe this past weekend, and a few months ago Abe gifted the president with the most Donald Trump golf club that has ever been created. Here's the $3,755 gold, anti-slice golf driver Shinzo Abe gave Trump a few months ago pic.twitter.com/tWDWDzAbyq 
— Brian Sozzi (@BrianSozzi) February 10, 2017 
The president and Prime Minister Abe finally got to test out the gold-plated ball striker at a few of Trump’s courses over the weekend, and Politico got a glimpse of the president wielding his new driver. In @POLITICO Playbook: Palm Beach update: pix of Trump on driving range + inside Steve Schwarzman's 70th bday bash: https://t.co/eyJAECTeGb pic.twitter.com/WlY2xU0Use 
— Daniel Lippman (@dlippman) February 12, 2017 
We sure hope that anti-slice technology works. 
Thumbnail photo via Jason Getz/USA TODAY Sports Images More Stories
